intro: Stenochlaena cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, showy spathe and spadix inflorescence. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in wet, tropical environments. Its rhizomes are used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. The botanical features of this plant make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
